alert.note: Alert for Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 3:27PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Gulf, southwestern Liberty and northwestern Franklin Counties through 400 PM EDT/300 PM CDT/... At 327 PM EDT/227 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Wewahitchka, or 17 miles northeast of Port St. Joe. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wewahitchka, Honeyville, Sumatra, Chipola Cutoff, Howard Creek, Willis Landing and Dalkeith. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
